content.description: BEWARE the loose horizontal as you boulder up past the ferny ledge.  Follow the obvious large right-facing corner.  You can stay left on the arete and face or stem up the corner.
content.protection: Standard rack (small stuff).  Trees at top for TR anchors.
content.location: The obvious right-facing corner.  Bushwhack climber's right from the top.

content.description: Boulder up the horizontal features to a fern-bedecked ledge.  A couple more moves get you to the start of a small, left-facing corner.  Follow the corner.  As the name implies, the crux is at the top.
content.protection: Trees at top for TR anchors.

content.description: 100 feet below the Main Slab and 50 feet below the Lower Cliff, there is a relatively smooth, clear face that is about 40 ft tall and 70 feet wide.  The main face has a prominent, 3 ft. right-facing corner,  On the left side is a small, left-facing corner.  The cliff is rarely climbed hence a bit dirty, but the rock quality is good.  The area is well-shaded by trees.
